intro: Racosperma complanatum, commonly known as the flat-leaf acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features bipinnate leaves that are often flattened, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense, globular clusters. Racosperma complanatum is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
